main event: At Fairchild Air Force Base on January 20, 1952, two airmen observed a brilliant bluish-white circular-shaped object leaving a blue trail while flying at approximately 500 feet below the clouds.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3 minutes and was reported to be traveling at a high speed, possibly faster than the speed of sound,Two airmen reported the sighting, while others nearby did not see it due to its brief visibility,The object had a blue trail that dissipated after a few seconds,The investigation concluded that if the object was under the cloud ceiling, it could not be a conventional aircraft or meteor, but its identity remains unknown.
witness description: Two Wing Intelligence airmen, one a Tech Sergeant and the other a Master Sergeant, noted the object's characteristics.
